boone

Class Neuron

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.BrainPart
      • boone.Neuron
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpikingNeuron

    public class Neuron
extends BrainPart
implements Storable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable
    Class representing a Neuron or Unit in the Neural Network. It is designed to be base class and default implementation at the same time.

    NOTE: - the actual worker methods of links (adding, removing) are found in the Link class.
    - for persistence, the default methods in the Boone class work.
    - A Neuron doesn't contain a reference to the NeuralNet it is contained by.

    Version:
    $Id: Neuron.java 2296 2018-04-16 12:29:15Z helmut $
    Author:
    August Mayer, Helmut A. Mayer

      • position

        protected Position position
        The neuron position.

      • inputNeuron

        Am I an input neuron? Default: false.

      • outputNeuron

        protected boolean outputNeuron
        Am I an output neuron? Default: false.

      • layer

        protected int layer
        The layer number.

      • usingBias

        protected boolean usingBias
        Indicates usage of bias value (default is true).

      • bias

        protected double bias
        The bias value.

      • deltaBias

        protected double deltaBias
        The last bias change.

      • errorSignal

        protected double errorSignal
        The error signal used for training.

      • externalInput

        protected double externalInput
        the external input signal, meant for the input of input neurons.

      • linkInput

        protected double linkInput
        The sum of the inputs from the links to this neuron. This is calculated step by step when the input link objects call the addLinkInput(double) method.

      • input

        protected double input
        Current input signal. Calculated in the calculate() method by adding the linkInput and the externalInput values.

      • output

        protected double output
        The current neuron output.

      • links

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Link> links
        All the neuron's links.

        public Neuron(boolean _inputNeuron,
              boolean _outputNeuron,
              boolean _usingBias)
        Creates a default Neuron. For input neurons, sets the activation function to Identity.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Neuron clone()
        Returns a semi-deep clone of this neuron. The clone's link list is empty. Note that the name is a reference to the cloned neuron.
        Overrides:
        clone in class BrainPart
        Returns:

        Randomizes the bias value within [-0.1, 0.1).

      • randomize

        public void randomize(double minValue,
                      double maxValue)
        Randomizes the bias value within the given bounds.
        Parameters:
        minValue - lower bound
        maxValue - upper bound

      • calculate

        public void calculate()
        Propagate the neuron input to the neuron output.

        The neuron input (externalInput and linkInput) are already filled with the input values at this time.
        Doesn't calculate the output links; see propagateOutput() instead.

        Calculates the following values for this neuron: input, and output. Resets the linkInput to zero.

        Overrides:
        calculate in class BrainPart

      • propagateOutput

        public void propagateOutput()
        Sends the neuron's activation onto the link.

        Calls Link.propagate(boone.Neuron) for each link of this neuron.

      • getExternalInput

        public double getExternalInput()
        Returns:
        Value of property externalInput.

      • setExternalInput

        public void setExternalInput(double externalInput)
        Set the neuron's external input, e.g. the environment signal for input neurons. This is the correct place to put the input pattern (but it is probably more convenient to use NeuralNet.setInput(double[]).

        Please also note that this attribute may be reset to zero on network evaluation, if the NeuralNet.setZeroInputAfterFirstCycle(boolean) flag is set to true (e.g. for Hopfield networks).

        Parameters:
        externalInput - New value of property externalInput.

      • getInput

        public double getInput()
        Return the neuron input, which is the sum of externalInput, linkInput, and bias (if usingBias is enabled). Calculated in the calculate() method.
        Returns:
        Value of property input.

      • setInput

        public void setInput(double input)
        Sets the current input value of the neuron. Please note that on calculate(), this value is calculated as the sum of externalInput, linkInput, and bias (the latter only if usingBias is enabled), and thus overwritten on network calculation.
        Parameters:
        input - New value of property input.

      • getOutput

        public double getOutput()
        Returns the current output value of this neuron.
        Returns:
        the output value

      • setOutput

        public void setOutput(double output)
        Set the current output value of this neuron. Only for special cases, or internal use.
        Parameters:
        output - New value of property output.

      • getLinkTo

        public Link getLinkTo(Neuron other)
        Returns the link connecting this neuron to the given other neuron, which may also be the same neuron. This method also considers the direction of the connection. If this neuron has a directed connection to the other neuron, the link is returned. If it has the opposite direction, null is returned. Of course, with an undirected connection, the link between A and B (if there) is always returned.
        Parameters:
        other - the other neuron possibly linked to this neuron
        Returns:
        the link from this to other (null, if no connection)

      • getInputLinkCount

        public int getInputLinkCount()
        Returns the number of input links.
        Returns:
        the number of links which receive signals

      • getInputLink

        public Link getInputLink(int index)
        Returns the input link of given index.
        Returns:
        the input link, null if not there

      • getOutputLinkCount

        public int getOutputLinkCount()
        Returns the number of output links.
        Returns:
        the number of links which transmit the neuron's output

      • getOutputLink

        public Link getOutputLink(int index)
        Returns the output link of given index.
        Returns:
        the output link, null if not there
